title: Body cam and incident report for interaction I was apart of on March 26,2024

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

On March 26th my father myself and my fiance were pulled over leaving life storage self storage on Murphy in Irvine sometime between 3pm  & 6pm or after?. I was ordered at gun point to exit vehicle. I was searched against my will, as well as my wife who requested a female officer for any pat down as she was not comfortable with treatment we were receiving but was searched by a male anyways. Pressured to have vehicle searched which I refused.. After 45 minutes they finished their investigation and told us we're free to go. I asked why they stopped us in the first place and was told that employee from storage (falsely) claimed that we broke into storage units.  I was there 20 minutes and only dropped stuff off, left with nothing so I completely didn't understand and need a report plus body cam leading up to the stop when the employee made his report/statement to officers that responded to take his statement prior and ultimately leading immediately to our interaction. I'm requesting this In order to possibly pursue legal action against storage company. I requested names and badge numbers several times and in the end was only given an incident# ,  2 names and 1 badge number. Officer Gomi/Carrasco badge #666 
Incident# 240311989
March 26th 2024
Originated at Life storage on Murphy 
Pulled over on mcgaw

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Quinteros

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of any and all 911 calls, CAD reports, dispatch logs, or any other manner of record, data, or other media publicly available, and made by, referencing, or in any manner pertaining to or otherwise involving or mentioning Mica Acacia Miller, aged 30 (deceased), occurring, collected, made, or generated on or about any part of Friday, April 26, 2024 and Saturday, April 27, 2024, in or near Myrtle Beach, Horry County, South Carolina.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth Hooven

title: FOIA Request for John-Paul Miller (Myrtle Beach Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of any and all 911 calls, CAD reports, dispatch logs, or any other manner of record, data, or other media publicly available, and made by, referencing, or in any manner pertaining to or otherwise involving or mentioning John-Paul Miller (Pastor), aged ~44 years; occurring, collected, made, or generated in or near Myrtle Beach, Horry County, South Carolina.

Particularly: battery, assault, domestic violence or deadly weapon allegations and/or charges.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elizabeth Hooven
